text: hello and welcome to Mechanical Turk
this tutorial provides a short
demonstration on how to improve the
quality of your results by setting up
qualifications in mechanical Turks
requestor user
interface requesters consistently tell
us that using qualifications
significantly increases the quality of
their results this is because
qualifications allow requesters to
direct hits to workers on Mechanical
Turk with proven performance
histories adding qualification to your
hit is easy to get started make sure
that you're logged into your requester
account on Mechanical
Turk whether you're creating a new
project or editing a project created
previously qualification settings are
located in the edit project section
under the create tab in the top
navigation if you're creating a new
project you will arrive at the edit
project section after you select the
type of hit that you would like to
create how however in this demonstration
I'm going to edit qualification settings
on a data collection project that I
created
previously if you're adding
qualifications to a previously created
project click the edit button next to
the project you'd like to edit to get
started next under the enter properties
tab scroll down to the section of the
page labeled working on your
hit Mechanical Turk Masters is the first
qualification option that you'll see as
you scroll down what or more
appropriately who are Masters Masters
are Elite groups of workers that have
demonstrated accuracy in specific types
of hits on the Mechanical Turk
Marketplace if your hits are
categorization or photo moderation you
can direct your hits to masters with
proven expertise in your type of hit by
selecting either categorization or photo
moderation Master's
workers if you're hit does not qualify
as a photo moderation or categorization
task direct your hit to experienced
proven workers by using the additional
qualifications to direct your hits to
the most experienced workers use the
number of hits approved
qualification based on requestor
feedback we recommend that you set your
requirement at a minimum of greater than
5,000 approved assignments this means
that only workers who've successfully
completed 5,000 assignments will have
access to your
hit in addition setting the hit approval
rate qualification at a level greater
than 95% will direct your work to the
highest quality workers as determined by
their approval rate from other
requesters in the Mechanical Turk
Marketplace requesters frequently tell
us that the combination of these two
qualifications has a significant effect
on on the overall quality of
results you'll notice other system
qualifications available in the other
qualifications dropdown menu in this
tutorial we're focused on qualifications
that direct hits to workers based on
experience and past performance in our
Marketplace however it's worth noting
that there are additional system
qualifications available depending on
the requirements of your project you
have the option of implementing
qualifications that direct hits to
workers in specific geographies or
workers who have agreed to work on hits
containing adult content in addition you
also have the option of creating your
own custom qualifications to direct your
hits to workers who have performed well
on your hits
previously once you've completed the
configuration of your qualifications be
sure to save your updated hit settings
by clicking save in the bottom right
hand corner of the screen if you're
creating a new hit continue to enter
your hits properties and move on to the
next step of designing your hit
template
